name: do logging
info:
This subflow simulates data received from a _real tuya device_, i.e. it builds an 'event' to be sent to the `core.logging` input. General purpose, used to build events in mirror and fake devices. ### Parameters
remote string | @string | NULL
the tuyaDEAMON instance (as in _core.global.remotemap_) or NULL. - Default: NULL => delete 'remote' (i.e. local) - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `ANDROID` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@global.get('instance_name')` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.remote` value
deviceID string | @string (credential)
the device user-name or `ID` or `CID` (as in _core.global.alldevices_). - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `core` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.TUYABRDG` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@"tuya"+"_bridge"` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.deviceID` value
propertyDP string | @string
the data point ID or user.name (string: "3" or "_version") - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `foo` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.COUNTDP` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@global.get()` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.propertyDP` value
valueany | @string | NULL
the new value from the device. - Default: NULL => "" - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `foo` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@Date.now()` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.value` value
### Input Any, used only to provoke the output, but values like `msg.logging.remote` can override the parameters. ### Output ````` object { "payload": { "remote_from" : , // optional "deviceId": , "data": { "dps": { "" = }}} ````` ### References see [native event format](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#native-event-format).

name: format logging msg
info: implements 'NULL' rules, format output object.

name: late binding
info:
See [Subflows and configuration: late and runtime parameters binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042)

Modified:
- added evalued binding: @<expression>  => eval(<expression>). e.g. `@Date.now()` 
- runtime override: uses `msg.logging.xxx`

label: core_SYSTEM
info:
Since ver. 2.0 '_sistem' is implemented as a 'fake SW device. ### Features - a 'proxy' command to manage communications between multiple instances of tuyaDEAMON on lan. - a centralized information point about tuyaDAEMON and the status of the devices, especially useful in security applications. - 'clean' access to tuyaDAEMON and host PC resources, for automation projects, like messages, beep, voice, timer, exec, etc. - SYSTEM extends the capability to implement customized automation task using only 'share' structure (example: _beep_loop2 implementation). For more information
see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system ### Installation see [github documentation](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaDAEMON#installation) ### Configuration User must update the node: `'global SYSTEM config'`: follow the node documentation.

Uses the home page of http://nodered.com. 
If this page changes in future you must update the FINDSTRING code.

Fired at any change.

name: checks all fake cmds, _system cmd selector (1)
info:
Fake device rules:

GET: returns last value, in some cases from `tuyastatus.device.property`
    do not use it as TRIGGER: GET is without side effect, can be repeated.
    
SET: set a value, returns the same value setted.

SET as TRIGGER: the value CAN be discarted ('any').
   Returns always immediatly a value, data or only info like "done", "sent", "WARNING...", ...
   Can PUSH more results later.
 
SCHEMA: returns values for all readable DPs (like GET)

name: _system cmd selector (2)
info:
Select GET/SET/SCHEMA/MULTIPLE  commands 
for 'fake' device

Implementation:

"_system":"_trgPing" accepts only GET: fires a data refresh.
             
The stadard GET tuyaDAEMON request
````
    msg.payload:{
        "device":"_system", 
        "property":"_trgPing"  
        } 
````        
fires a flow that implements the command.

name: _system (fake device)
info:
a) Initial configuration: see `*Global SYSTEM config` node. b) EXPECTED OUTPUT at start, in sidebar: ```` 26/4/2023, 10:48:13node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info msg.payload : array[2] [ "RX: HAL@home/_laststart", "2023-04-26 10:48:14" ] ```` b) TEST FLOW Test mini-flows are present for virtually all features. See result in sidebar. ### Troubleshooting ### 1. _After 'Deploy' the module don't send nothing to sidebar log_ 2. _Some tests do not work at all (no log)_ _Cause_: The 'Deploy', after an 'Import', sometime (not clear why) do not set external 'link' nodes. **Important: After 'Import' + 'Deploy' CHECK all external links nodes**.
As help, the name of all Links shows the origin or the destination (e.g.: `from core.'to fake devices'`, `to core.'logging'`) 3. _fake deviceID 'required'_
Doing any DB test, or using `'_system._sqlDBlocal'` or `'_system._sqlDBremote'` you get as response: ```` 0: "ERROR [OUT data]: ADD to alldevices the real/fake deviceId: required (undefined)" 1: object ```` The cause is an null value for 'deviceID' (after an `'import'+'deploy'`) in the `CORE.do logging` subflow near the `CORE.execute on DB local` node.
Set it to `[string] _system`. (credential not required). **GENERAL WARNING**: the `'import'+'Deploy'` does not copy `'credential' parameters`. TuyaDAEMON uses `credential` only in input fields containing `'id'` and `'key'` of Tuya devices (optional).
_So you must check all nodes with the 'credential' option:_ - `tuya-smart-device` node - `do logging`, `do command`, `static retry`, `dynamic retry`, `REFRESH` CORE subflows. note: exception is the `CORE.'*device selector'` node because the `switch` node-red node does not accept `credentials` (see [request77622](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/switch-node-accepts-credentials-in-test-value/77622)) ------------------------------------ 2.2.2 - refactoring some nodes (added 'let', 'const': var declaration) - updated installation istructions 2.2.1: Bug list - Reduced 'power' options to BAT, AC, UPS W - Bad use of 'Max time' in REFRESCH parameter, replaced by 'Max_time' (MUST be a js variable name)

name: proxy
info: used to do REST between tuyaDAEMON instances

name: Alarms (readme)
info:
SYSTEM Alarms:

See system, `_ACpower`, `_ACunconnected`,  `_LANnet`, `_WIFInet`, `_WIFIunconnected`, `_laststart` DPs.

Checked for any changes in the state of the devices and according to the definition of "power" of the device
(requires some devices to work):

- **AC_ALARM**:      some real devices are 'AC' powered AND  all are unconnected

- **WIFI_ALARM**:    some real devices are not 'BAT' powered AND not AC_ALARM AND all are unconnected

- **LAN_ALARM**:     can not cannect a web site (default: nodered.com).

Only at start:

- **start_DEAMON**:  signals tuyaDAEMON start, after the initial connection activity.
                     User defined delay (defaut 10 s). Example: can be used to do initial UI refresh.

note: user can reduce the Alarm visibility (see [hide](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#output-control))  or disable related nodes.

name: tuyastatus
test GET last benckmark
info:
GET: returns benchmark settings.

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

name: test zeroTASK
info:
ZeroTask is the simplest and fastest task of tuyaDAEMON: it does nothing.
Without any logs, it is used for stress tests and benchmarks.

Running this you do not see any effect, any log.... of course !

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

name: test zeroLOG
info:
ZeroLog does nothing, but it does logs. Also used for stress tests and benchmarks.

IN SET case, it returns the actal value.

note: this feature can be used to test an ENCODE function, or, in general, to ceck the user values processing, changing temporally the alldevices definition for _zeroLOG ("type" or "typefield") and putting a test value in "value".

https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

On the Debug sidebar:

           25/4/2023, 09:09:49node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info
           msg.payload : array[2]
             array[2]
             0: "RX: HAL@home/_zeroLog"
             1: array[2]
                 0: "Normalized SET value: string"
                 1: "any"

name: START doBenckmark (SET)
info:
This start a benchmark, prepared by '_benchmark' property.

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

Expected result:
 
     [ "TX: SET fake HAL@home/_doBench", "start" ]
     [ "RX: HAL@home/_doBenchmark", "started" ]

     [ "TX: SET fake HAL@home/_timerON", object ]
     [ "RX: HAL@home/_timerON", "Sat Apr 02 2022 13:14:21 GMT+0" ]

 Now run the test task (in this case zeroTASK, so no messages )

     [ "RX: HAL@home/_timerON", "Done id: bench" ]
     
     [ "RX: HAL@home/_doBenchmark", object ]
     
note: in `node-red` the order of debug pad messages is not guaranteed.

name: choose benckmark:  zeroTask  (5s)
info:
This prepare a benchmak using _zeroTask for 10 s.
The benchmark starts using doBenchmark

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

name: choose benckmark:  zeroLog (10s)
info:
This prepare a benchmak using _zeroLog for 20 s.

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

name: test  GET doBenckmark
info: GET: it returns last result or 'none'.

name: *_system custom selector (3)
info:
CUSTOMIZATION

Adding/deleting DB: here is the case of 2 DB 

To add/modify DB
  
 - set 2 nodes for every DB (log, no-log)
 - update '*all DB status' node
  
 - define a `_system` property for every DB (like `_sqlDBlocal`, `_sqlDBremote`) 
 
 - add properties to alldevices (using `tuyadaemotoolkit` if you like)
 
 - edit this function: one 'dp' for DB

name: test  BEEP LOOP
info:
note:
This is an example of command repetiton, build in 
Global.AllDevice structure, using 'share' capabilities.

see  https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#user-interface

OUTPUT (with default 'hide' setting)
````
       //  no TX for `HAL@home/_beep_loop` because defined 'SKIP', only RX
msg.payload : array[2]
[ "RX: HAL@home/_beep_loop", object ]
26/4/2023, 21:26:16node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info
       //  no TX for `HAL@home/_beep` because 'share' uses 'fast_cmd'
msg.payload : array[2]
[ "RX: HAL@home/_beep", "done" ]
26/4/2023, 21:26:17node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info
       // no timer TX/RX because hide = 'K' for 'HAL@home/_timerON'
       // round 2
msg.payload : array[2]
[ "RX: HAL@home/_beep_loop", object ]
26/4/2023, 21:26:17node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info

msg.payload : array[2]
[ "RX: HAL@home/_beep", "done" ]
26/4/2023, 21:26:18node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info
       // round 3
msg.payload : array[2]
[ "RX: HAL@home/_beep_loop", object ]
26/4/2023, 21:26:17node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info

msg.payload : array[2]
[ "RX: HAL@home/_beep", "done" ]
26/4/2023, 21:26:18node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info
        // round 4: exit
msg.payload : array[2]
array[2]
0: "RX: HAL@home/_beep_loop"
1: object
count: 0          // exit condition
timeout: 1000

````

name: remote log
command/share select
GET _laststart  property
info:
returs this run value:
          ["RX: HAL@home/_laststart","2022-03-27 08:56:24"]
          
see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#_laststart

name: SET _tuyastatus ()
info:
This is a SET (it as a value) but really it is a trigger for an action: to 'get tuyastatus data'.
 
  If payload.value.device does NOT exist,
         returns a 'list' of all devices in tuyastatus, using usernames (if defined).
         
  Example:
   
              list: array[3]
                 0: "tuya_bridge"
                 1: "core"
                 2: "HAL@home"
   
   see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: SET tuyastatus ( _system. _laststart )  to a fake value
info:
This command is a SET (because it contains a value) but is actually a trigger for an action: to 'set tuyastatus data'.

     If payload.value.device exists,
     AND there is payload.value.property,
     AND there is payload.value.value:
         this SET the value to 'tuyastatus.device.property'.       
       
  ATTENTION: no checks are made on device, property and value, so it is possible to do anything (good) but it is dangerous, very dangerous: all the logic of tuyaDAMON can be broken (bad) !
  
    Example:
       this example sets a 'fake' value for 'system.laststart'. Check the result with the 'GET _laststart property' test
       
see  https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: GET _tuyastatus ( _core )
info:
This command is a SET (it as a value) but really it is a trigger for an action: to 'get tuyastatus data'.


     If payload.value.device exists,
     and there is NO payload.value.property:   
       it returns a object: a tuyastatus fragment
 
   Example:
       1: object
          device: "core"
          value: object
             schema: object
                _connected: true
                _DBase: true
                _heartbeat: "21:38:51"
                version: "none"
                _t: 1648327133

note: the 'schema' is 'as is' from 'tuyastatus', i.e. also with pseudoDPs (see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#pseudodp), like '_connected'.

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: GET _tuyastatus ( _system . _laststart )
info:
This command is a SET (because it contains a value) but is actually a trigger for an action: to 'get tuyastatus data'.

     If payload.value.device exists,
     AND there is payload.value.property,
     AND there is NO payload.value.value:
       it returns a message (GET) with the value of the tuyastatus.device.property
 
   Example:
       
           device: "HAL@home"
           property: "_laststart"
           
           you get a value like: "2022-03-27 08:58:22"

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: Test  SCHEMA  HAL@home
info:
Sends a SCHEMA request to the device,
   if SCHEMA is allowed, returns DP values
     else ERROR.

For_system, SCHEMA is implemented:

  A message for every GETtable DP, getting last data from 'tuyastatus' (faster)

see  https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: Test case for  _system + some devices
info:
system properties requiring devices.

- Some tests are based on WiFi and devices status, so some devices (UPS, BAT, AC)
  are reqired to get valid results.

- Some test require special devices, i.e. using RT/AVG subflow...(note using deviceID not in credentials)  

- doUPDATE: forces a GET for all DPs of all connected devices: as effect, tuyastatus
   is updated to last values.

note: "none" is the default initial value for many dPs.

see:
https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system

ALARM is true when WiFi looks down.

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#security-and-recovery

sound and voice features:

name: _toWarn  "user message"

_toWarn:

   Useful to signal problems and to send warning to remote

_toDebug:

name: _toLogging "system._toWarn.Done"
info:
_toLogging:
    Send a message to core.logging node, as a devices response message.
    Note:  device/property MUST exist in global.alldevices.
    
    
    see  https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#helper-functions

name: *Global SYSTEM config
info:
**SYSTEM** Configuration User defined values: _beep64_
The audio WAV data used by the `_beep` command is a string coded code64.
see 'Telemachus' node. ### more CUSTOMIZATIONS - **Global.alldevice** Update CORE.`Global.alldevice` adding the `_system` device:
- Add to 'fake' devices the '_system' definitions in the "device__system.json" file. - Customize it adding 2 lines on top (you can change the 'name'): ```` { add> "id": "_system", add> "name": "HAL@home", "device": "_system", ... more ... ```` - **Language**
To change the TTS _Voice/Language_, browser dependent, see SYSTEM.`*Telemachus` node properties.
On my Chrome the choice is: `en/it/es/fr/de/hi/jp/id`. - Some commands require the `'TRIGGER'` module installed to work. Optional: in case of misuse is sent a warning. ------------------------------ ### Programmer's notes: - To test the LAN connection, `_system` reads the home page of `http://nodered.com`, and checks for some text: this can change in future, update the 'LAN check' node, const FINDSTRING. - **DataBase** commands: changing the number or use of BDs, it may be necessary to update the `*_system custom selector (3)` node, reserved to DB commands.
See the comment node `CUSTOMIZE: DBase servers (readme)` in 'CORE'. ### Details 1. For users convenice, `system` also present some public node LINK (you can use them in applications): - **start_DAEMON** _fired after the initial delay_. - **AC ALARM**: _sends a msg every change of AC power_. - **WIFI ALARM**: _sends a msg every change of WiFi, if ACpower is true._ - **LAN ALARM**: _sends a msg every change of LAN status_. 2. `_system` is built as an addon: if your application doesn't need those resources, you can disable/delete this flow.

name: Test _doSCHEMA (HAL@home)
info:
The _system doSCHEMA property is implemented:
  
  for the device in Value:
     a GET request is done for every GETtable DP (slow)
     side effect: tuyastatus is updated.
     
   returns: a list of DPs.
   
   Example:
         device: "HAL@home"
         dps_get: array[21]
            [0  9]
                0: "_doSCHEMA"
                1: "_doUPDATE"
                2: "_ACpower"
                ... more ...
   
   Plus all GETs:

                [ "RX: HAL@home/_doSCHEMA", object ]
                [ "RX: HAL@home/_doUPDATE", "none" ]
                [ "RX: HAL@home/_ACpower", "none" ]
                ... more ...
     
not: doSCHEMA can be used with ANY device, also if device.SCHEMA is not available.     

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: _toShare: SET (zeroLog 3s) + START benchmark
info:
This test uses system.doShare to do 2 tasks in sequence:
    1) system._benchmark (to prepare a benchmark using zeroLog for 15 s).
    2) system._doBenchmark (to execute the benchmark)
    
    
see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#benchmark

name: system flow startup
info:
## Programmer's note on startup.

If you add new proprties to _system (e.g. new DB commands),
maybe you must update this to do all required initializations.

See also 'On Start', 'On Stop' function.

name: core start
doUPDATE   real only
info:
The _system doUPDATE property is implemented:
  
  for ALL connected devices found in real|virtual|fake|NULL(all) alldevices list:
     a doSCHEMA request is sent.
 
 see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

_toGlobal

   SET a Global variable, to start RT mode

name: test end RT, start AVG
info:
_toGlobal
   Requires a device using RT/AVG subflow.
   SET a Global variable, to start AVG mode

name: Test _exec ( notepad.exe )
info:
System exec (System dependece)
 Used for test 'notepad.exe'.
 
 This task ends when the application is closed.
 
 see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#_exec
 
 expected result:
 
    ["TX: SET fake HAL@home/_exec", "notepad.exe" ]
    [ "RX: HAL@home/_exec", "started" ]
   
  notepad pops up.
  After closed notepad:

   [ "RX: HAL@home/_exec", "done" ]
